headline: Tesla slides, Renault’s $11B hit, Oracle rallies: Trending Tickers
summary: Morning Brief: Market Sunrise host Ramzan Karmali covers some of today's trending tickers. Tesla (TSLA) shares are down after sales plunged more than 60% in Sweden and Denmark last month, and Trump called for a review of subsidies tied to Elon Musk’s companies. Renault (RNO.PA) posted an $11 billion loss on its stake in automaker Nissan (NSANY), which continues to struggle with EV sales. Oracle's (ORCL) stock hit an all-time high after the company announced cloud deals expected to bring in $30 billion annually starting in 2028. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief: Market Sunrise here.

headline: Which AI Stocks May Soar After Reaching Record Highs?
summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) stocks have rebounded and even roared higher in recent weeks.  After declines earlier in the year, many artificial intelligence (AI) stocks have rebounded and even skyrocketed amid optimism that U.S. trade decisions won't weigh heavily on growth.  Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), Oracle (NYSE: ORCL), and Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO) still have plenty of room to run.
